originalTitle: Bid launched to extend Zimbabwe president's term in office
title: Big News from Beautiful Zimbabwe!
content:
Hello everyone! I'm your friendly news reporter from Africa! Today, we have some special news from a beautiful country called Zimbabwe. It's a land full of amazing animals and wonderful people, just like you!

Meet Our Presidents

Every country has a leader, right? Like how your classroom has a teacher who helps everyone learn and play nicely. In a country, the leader is called a President! The President helps make sure everything works well. They help schools, hospitals, and make sure people are safe. It's a very big and important job! **Did you know?** Africa has 54 countries, and each one has a President or a leader! That's a lot of important people helping their countries grow!

Who is President Mnangagwa?

In Zimbabwe, their President is called President Mnangagwa. He is a very important person for his country. He works hard every day to help the people of Zimbabwe. He makes decisions to try and make life better for everyone, from grandmas and grandpas to little kids like you!

What is a "Term"?

Now, let's learn about a special word: "term." Imagine you get to play with your favorite toy for a certain amount of time, like 5 minutes. That's your play "term"! For Presidents, a "term" is how long they get to be the leader. It's like a set time for their very important job. It helps everyone know how long someone will be in charge. In many places, a President gets to be the leader for a few years. After that time, it's often time for new elections, where people get to choose a new President or choose the same one again.

President Mnangagwa's Time

President Mnangagwa has a "term" too. His time as President is set to finish in the year 2028. That's a few years from now, giving him time to do many good things! When his term finishes, people usually get ready to choose a new President. It's a very exciting time for the country, like choosing a new captain for your sports team. **Did you know?** The capital city of Zimbabwe is Harare! It's a big, busy city with many wonderful people living there!

A New Idea Called a "Bill"

But guess what? There's a new idea happening in Zimbabwe! This idea is called a "bill." It sounds like something you pay, but it's not! Imagine you and your friends have a rule about how long you play outside. Maybe someone has an idea to change that rule, like making playtime longer! That idea is like a "bill"! A "bill" is just a suggestion for a new rule or a change to an old rule for the whole country. It's how countries think about making things better or different. It's like a plan that important people talk about to decide if it's a good idea or not. They have to think very carefully about what will be best for everyone.

What is the Idea About?

This special "bill" in Zimbabwe is about the President's "term." It's about changing the time limit for the leader. The idea is to change the rule so that President Mnangagwa could stay as President for longer than 2028. It means his special time to lead might be extended, like getting more time to play with that fun toy! This would mean he could continue to guide Zimbabwe for more years, past the time that was originally planned.

Why Are Rules Important?

Having rules about how long a President serves is very important. It helps make sure everyone gets a fair chance to lead and that the country has a chance for new beginnings. It also means the country can sometimes have new ideas and new leaders to help it grow and solve new challenges. It keeps things fresh and fair! **Did you know?** Zimbabwe is famous for its beautiful Victoria Falls, one of the biggest waterfalls in the world! It's super amazing and makes a thunderous sound like a lion's roar!

How Do Ideas Become Rules?

A "bill" doesn't just become a rule instantly, like magic. It takes a lot of talking and thinking. First, many important people, like other leaders and people who represent the country's citizens, have to talk about it. They discuss if it's a good idea for the country and all its people. They might even vote, just like you vote for your favorite game to play in class. If enough people say yes, then the "bill" can become a new rule or "law" for everyone in the country to follow.

What Happens Next in Zimbabwe?

So, right now, people in Zimbabwe are talking about this "bill." They are sharing their thoughts and ideas. They are thinking about what it means for their country and their future. It's like when your class discusses a new rule for playtime. Everyone thinks about it carefully to make the best choice! Important discussions like these help shape the future of a country, making sure decisions are made with care.

Why This Matters to You!

Even though you are small, this news is important! Because the President and the rules affect everyone in the country, even the kids! It's about how Zimbabwe will grow and change in the future. The choices made today can affect your schools, your parks, and how your country works when you grow up. **Did you know?** Zimbabwe has lots of amazing animals like elephants, lions, giraffes, and zebras! It's like a giant, real-life animal park! So, that's the big news from Zimbabwe! We will keep watching to see what happens. It's exciting to learn about how countries work and how decisions are made for everyone. Bye for now, friends!
summary: An idea is being discussed in Zimbabwe to change the rules so that President Mnangagwa could stay as leader for longer than his current time, which is set to end in 2028.
whyMatters: This is important because the rules about who leads a country and for how long affect everyone, from big people to little kids, and shape the country's future.

originalTitle: African artefacts looted by British to be returned
title: Super Treasures Are Coming Home to Africa!
content:
Hello, Little News Explorers!

Hello, hello, my super curious friends from all over Africa! It’s your kid-friendly news reporter here, with a big, super exciting story that will make your heart sing! Are you ready for some amazing news? Get ready to clap your hands and cheer, because something very special is happening for our wonderful continent! We have heard some wonderful news all the way from Nigeria, a big and beautiful country in Africa. It’s a story about precious old treasures that are finally coming back home! Yes, you heard that right – special treasures are returning to where they belong, and that is truly something to celebrate!

What Are These Special Treasures?

Imagine looking at a very, very old photograph, but instead of a photo, it's a beautiful statue or a fancy carving made of wood or metal. These are called "artefacts" (say that with me: AR-te-facts!). They are like super old toys or important artworks that people made a long, long time ago. They tell us stories about the people who lived before us, how they lived, what they believed, and how artistic they were. These particular treasures are super special. Many of them are beautiful sculptures and plaques made of bronze – a shiny, strong metal. They show kings, queens, animals, and important events. They are like history books, but made of art! Did you know? These famous artefacts are often called the 'Benin Bronzes' because many of them came from the ancient Kingdom of Benin, which was in what we now call Nigeria. They are hundreds of years old!

A Long, Long Journey Away From Home

Now, here’s the sad part of the story, but don’t worry, it has a happy ending! A very, very long time ago, when your great-great-grandparents were probably just little babies, or even before that, something not very nice happened. Soldiers from a country far away, called Britain, came to Nigeria. This was in the late 1800s, like 130 years ago! That's a super long time ago! During a difficult time, these soldiers took many of these beautiful artefacts from Nigeria. They didn't ask for permission, and that's not fair. It was like someone took your favourite toy without asking and carried it very far away. We call this 'looting' or 'stealing', and it's not a kind thing to do. After they were taken, these special treasures were kept in museums in Britain and other countries far away. People from those countries could look at them and learn, but the people in Nigeria, where they came from, could not easily see their own history.

The Happy News! They Are Coming Home!

But guess what? The story gets much, much happier now! People in Britain, including many kind museums and universities, have listened. They understand that these treasures truly belong to Nigeria. So, they have decided to send them back home! Isn't that wonderful? This means that the beautiful bronze statues, carvings, and other special items that were taken a very, very long time ago will officially return to Nigeria. They are packing their bags (very carefully, of course!) and getting ready for their long journey back to Africa. It’s like when a lost pet finally finds its way back to its family. Everyone is super happy and excited! This is a big moment for Nigeria and for all of Africa.

Why Is This So Important for Africa?

This news is super important for many reasons! First, it's about fairness. These items belong to the people of Nigeria. They were made by Nigerian artists, they tell Nigerian stories, and they are part of Nigeria's heart and soul. Bringing them back means respecting Nigeria's history and its people. Second, these artefacts are like a giant family album for Nigeria. When they come back, children and adults in Nigeria can see them up close. They can learn about their ancestors, their rich culture, and the amazing things their people created. It helps everyone feel proud of their heritage. Did you know? Many countries in Africa have amazing old art and objects that tell wonderful stories about their past. It’s called 'cultural heritage', and it's super important to keep it safe! Third, it shows that people can work together to make things right. It’s a lesson in honesty and friendship between different countries. It tells us that when something is taken unfairly, we should try our best to bring it back.

Welcome Home, Beautiful Treasures!

When these treasures return, they will be kept in special places, like new museums, in Nigeria. This way, everyone, especially kids like you, can visit them. You can see with your own eyes the amazing art your ancestors created. Imagine standing in front of a statue made hundreds of years ago, knowing it came all the way home! This is a big step towards celebrating Africa's incredible history and art. It makes us proud to be African! It shows the world the beauty and wisdom that has always been here on our continent. So, let’s give a big cheer for the returning treasures! Welcome home, beautiful artefacts! We are so happy to have you back in Africa, where you belong. Keep exploring and learning, my little friends, because Africa has so many amazing stories to tell!
summary: Beautiful, super old treasures taken long ago by British soldiers are finally coming back home to Nigeria, which is very exciting news for Africa.
whyMatters: This is important because these special old objects belong to Nigeria, they tell amazing stories about Africa's history and culture, and now children in Nigeria can see their own heritage, showing fairness and pride for all of Africa.

content: All 55 people on board survived after the plane failed to land on the runway near the shoreline.

originalTitle: Ex-police chief said Trump told him in 2006 'everyone' knew of Epstein's behaviour
title: Heroes Who Stop Bad Things!
content:
Hello, my wonderful friends all across Africa! Your friendly news reporter is here with a very important story. It's about how brave people, like our amazing police, work hard to keep everyone safe, especially children. This story happened a long, long time ago, far away in a country called America, in a place called Florida. But its message is important for all of us, no matter where we live!

Meet the Helpers

Our story starts with some very important people: the police! You know the police, right? They are the brave men and women who wear uniforms and help us when we are in trouble. They make sure rules are followed and that bad people don't hurt others. They are like our community's superheroes! Did you know? Police officers train very hard to learn how to keep people safe. They learn how to solve mysteries, how to talk to people, and how to catch anyone doing wrong things.

A Man Doing Wrong Things

Once upon a time, in the year 2006, which was a very long time ago (even before many of your parents were grown-ups!), there was a man named Mr. Epstein. Now, Mr. Epstein was doing some very, very wrong things. He was not being kind to young people. These were things that hurt others and made them very sad and scared. What he was doing was against the rules, and it was against what is right. When someone does bad things, it's like a dark cloud trying to cover the sun. But our heroes, the police, always try to chase those dark clouds away!

The Police Find Out

The police in Florida found out about Mr. Epstein's wrong actions. They started to look into everything he was doing. This is called 'investigating.' When police investigate, they are like super detectives! They ask questions, they gather clues, and they try to find out the truth so they can stop the bad things from happening. They want to make sure everyone is safe and happy. Did you know? In many parts of Africa, we have special police units called 'Child Protection Units.' Their super important job is to make sure children are always safe and protected from harm.

A Famous Man Speaks Up

Now, here's where another very famous man comes into our story. His name is Mr. Donald Trump. At that time, he was not the president of America yet, but he was a very well-known person. Someone said, or 'allegedly,' Mr. Trump called the police in Florida. He wanted to talk to them about Mr. Epstein and the wrong things he was doing. This is like when you see someone doing something wrong to your friend, and you bravely tell a grown-up or a teacher so they can help. Speaking up is very important!

'Everyone Knew'?

When Mr. Trump spoke to the police, he said something interesting. He said that 'everyone knew' about Mr. Epstein's bad behaviour. What does that mean? It means that many grown-ups in the area might have heard whispers or seen signs that Mr. Epstein was doing bad things. But sometimes, people are scared to speak up, or they don't know what to do. But it's so important that if you ever see or hear about someone being unkind or doing wrong things, especially to a child, you must tell a trusted grown-up! Like your mom, dad, teacher, an elder, or a police officer. They are there to help you and keep you safe. Did you know? The word 'behaviour' simply means how a person acts or does things. Good behaviour means being kind and following rules. Bad behaviour means doing things that hurt others or break rules.

Thank Goodness You're Stopping Him!

Mr. Trump told the police something very nice and very strong. He said, "thank goodness you're stopping him." This means he was very happy and thankful that the police were working to make Mr. Epstein stop his bad actions. He was glad that the police were being heroes and making things right. It’s a wonderful feeling when we know that bad things are being stopped. It makes our communities safer and helps everyone feel happier and more secure. This is why we are so proud of our police officers and everyone who helps to keep our communities strong and safe.

Why This Story Matters

Even though this happened far away and a long time ago, it teaches us a very important lesson. It teaches us that it's super important to stop bad things from happening. It shows us that police officers are there to help, and they are very brave. And it also teaches us that if we ever know about someone doing wrong things, especially to young people, we must, must, MUST tell a grown-up who can help. We must never keep secrets about things that hurt others. Every child deserves to be safe and happy. And every grown-up has a job to help make that happen. Let's all be like the good people in this story and make sure we look out for each other and keep our world, especially our beautiful Africa, a safe and loving place for all children! Thank you for listening, my friends!
summary: A famous man named Donald Trump thanked police in Florida a long time ago for stopping another man, Mr. Epstein, who was doing very wrong things, reminding us how important it is for heroes like the police to keep everyone safe.
whyMatters: This story matters because it teaches us that it's very important to stop bad people from doing wrong things, especially to children. It shows that police are brave helpers, and it reminds us to always tell a trusted grown-up if we know about something bad happening, so everyone can be safe and happy.

content: The mother of the news anchor Savannah disappeared in the middle of night from her Tucson, Arizona, home and was last seen on 31 January.

originalTitle: Frank insists he is safe - but will he avoid Spurs sack?
title: Our Friend Mr. Frank and His Football Team!
content:
Hello from Africa!

Welcome, young sports fans, from sunny Africa! I'm your friendly news reporter, ready to tell you an exciting story about football. Football, or soccer as some call it, is a game many of us love to play and watch. It's all about teams, goals, and working together. Today, we have a special story about a man named Mr. Frank and his important job.

Meet Our Friend, Mr. Frank

There is a very important person in a football team called a manager. Our story is about a kind manager named Mr. Frank. He works very hard with his team in a big football competition called the Premier League. Imagine a huge school sports day, but for grown-ups who are super good at kicking a ball! That's a bit like the Premier League. Mr. Frank is like the head teacher or the captain of a big ship. He makes sure everyone knows what to do. He wants his team to play their very best every time they step onto the field. He teaches them, he cheers them on, and he helps them learn from their mistakes. It’s a very important job, full of big responsibilities and lots of planning.

What Does a Football Manager Do?

A football manager is more than just a coach. They choose which players will play in each match. They decide on the team's plan, like how they will attack to score goals or how they will defend to stop the other team from scoring. They also help the players stay healthy and happy. It's like being a super organiser and a cheerleader all rolled into one! Did you know? Many famous football players from Africa, like Didier Drogba from Côte d'Ivoire or Samuel Eto'o from Cameroon, played in big leagues like the Premier League! They had managers just like Mr. Frank helping them become the best.

Playing in the Big League!

Mr. Frank's team plays in a very exciting league called the Premier League. It’s one of the biggest and best football competitions in the whole world! Teams from all over the country play against each other, trying to win as many games as they can. Every match is important, and every goal counts! Imagine you are in a big race with many runners. Everyone wants to be at the front, right? In football, teams also want to be at the top of the table. Being at the top means you are doing very well. Being at the bottom means you might need to work a little harder.

What is the 'Danger Zone'?

Now, here's a tricky part. Sometimes, teams don't win many games. When this happens, they might get too close to something called the 'relegation zone'. This sounds a bit scary, but it just means the teams at the very bottom of the league table. If a team finishes in the 'relegation zone', it means they might have to play in a slightly less big league next year. It's like if you were in a very advanced class, and then had to move to a slightly less advanced one to get stronger for next time. Mr. Frank's team is currently a little bit close to this 'danger zone'. They are just five points away. Five points might sound small, but in football, every point is like a little step on a ladder. They want to climb up, not down! So, they need to win more games and earn more points to move further away from the bottom.

Is Mr. Frank Safe?

When a team is near the 'relegation zone', sometimes people start to wonder about the manager's job. This is called 'getting the sack', which means losing your job. But Mr. Frank is very brave! He says, 'My job is safe!'. He believes in himself and his team. He is confident that they will play better and move away from the 'danger zone'. It's very important to be confident, just like Mr. Frank. Even when things are a bit tough, believing in yourself and your team can help you do great things. He is showing everyone that he is strong and determined. He wants to lead his team to success and keep them in the big league. Did you know? George Weah, a famous football player from Liberia, not only played in big European leagues but also became the President of his country! He showed great leadership on and off the field.

Why It's Good to Be Brave

Being brave like Mr. Frank is a wonderful quality. It means you don't give up easily, even when things are challenging. He is telling his team and all their fans, 'Don't worry, we can do this!'. This kind of leadership makes everyone feel stronger and more hopeful. When you play games with your friends, sometimes your team might be losing. But if you keep trying your best, and your leader keeps cheering you on, you can sometimes turn things around and win! That's what Mr. Frank hopes his team will do.

Teamwork Makes the Dream Work!

In football, teamwork is super important. No single player can win a game all by themselves. They all need to pass the ball, help each other, and work together like a well-oiled machine. Mr. Frank's job is to make sure his team is a perfect team. Each player has a special role, just like in a big orchestra where everyone plays a different instrument but creates one beautiful song. If everyone works together, they can score goals and stop the other team, moving them further away from the 'danger zone'. Did you know? The first African country to play in a FIFA World Cup was Egypt in 1934! They showed the world that African football is strong and talented.

What Happens Next?

So, what will happen next for Mr. Frank and his team? They have many more games to play. They will train very hard, listen to Mr. Frank's plans, and try their very best to win. Every game is a new chance to show how good they are and to earn more points. We will be watching with excitement to see how Mr. Frank's team performs. We hope they play bravely, work together, and move far away from the 'danger zone'. Go, team, go! We wish Mr. Frank and his wonderful team all the best from Africa!
summary: Manager Mr. Frank insists his job is safe even though his football team is close to the 'relegation zone' in the big Premier League competition.
whyMatters: This story matters because it shows how important teamwork and bravery are, even when things are tough, and reminds us that everyone, even grown-up football managers, needs to try their best to succeed.
